title: Mount, ca. 1805
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander
description: Winged female sphinx facing right with acanthus leaf crown from which springs an ancanthus-like flower, a tall symmetrically leafed and berried stem and a long spiraled leafed stem ending in a rosette. Sphinx's tail is an elongated acanthus leaf ending in a double spiraled stem, each of which terminates in a rosette. Seven screw holes and two small threaded projections under feet for attachment to wood. End broken off center stem projecting from crown.

tombstone.epitaph: Mount, ca. 1805. Gilt bronze. Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander. 1907-1-250-a/e.
